summary:
K-pop, short for Korean pop music, is a popular genre from South Korea that blends various global music styles with traditional Korean roots. It gained international popularity in the 2000s. K-pop's modern form emerged in the 1990s, revolutionizing South Korea's music scene with hip-hop and dance elements.

The genre has a strong "idol" culture, with artists like TVXQ and BoA expanding K-pop's reach to Japan and beyond. K-pop's global popularity, known as the Korean Wave, has grown significantly, with artists like BTS and Blackpink leading the way. However, the industry has also faced controversies regarding idol treatment, restrictive contracts, and high expectations.
title: K-pop
